lessons.title: Lesson #9
lessons.interactiveContent:
Add a CSS class to the Footer component to make the rule in the Footer.css file apply.

Make sure to type className.

lessons.title: Lesson #10
lessons.interactiveContent:
What should you avoid if you want component-specific CSS?

Importing global CSS into every componentUsing inline styles inside componentsWriting CSS in JavaScriptUsing one CSS file per component

Importing global CSS into every component.

lessons.title: Lesson #12
lessons.interactiveContent:
What happens when you import Alert.css in Header.jsx?

Styles defined in Alert.css affect all relevant elements globallyStyles only affect the Header componentNo styles are applied since the file isn't Header.cssAn error is thrown

Styles defined in Alert.css affect all relevant elements globally.

lessons.title: Lesson #7
lessons.interactiveContent:
Create the CSS rule for the class defined in the App component.

Make sure to type .largeText.

lessons.title: Lesson #6
lessons.interactiveContent:
How are class selectors identified in the CSS file?

. followed by the ID name# followed by the ID name@ followed by the ID name- followed by the ID name

. followed by the ID name.

lessons.title: Lesson #8
lessons.interactiveContent:
What is the correct way to link a stylesheet in HTML?

<link rel="stylesheet" href="index.css"><style src="index.css"><link rel="stylesheet" src="index.css"><style rel="stylesheet" href="index.css">

<link rel="stylesheet" href="index.css">.

lessons.title: Lesson #8
lessons.interactiveContent:
How do you make a text bold using React inline styling?

Use { fontWeight: "bold" }Use { font-weight: "bold" }Use { fontWeight = "bold" }Use { "font-weight": "bold" }

Use { fontWeight: "bold" }.

lessons.title: Lesson #6
lessons.interactiveContent:
How are CSS rules formatted within the style object in React JSX?

Using camelCase for property namesUsing kebab-case for property namesProperties must be quoted stringsProperties must end with a semicolon

Using camelCase for property names.

lessons.title: Lesson #7
lessons.interactiveContent:
Create a styles object and assign it to the style property of the div.

Make sure to pick const followed by bannerStyle and then {, }, bannerStyle.

lessons.title: Lesson #5
lessons.interactiveContent:
Implement a basic box component which changes background color upon receiving a different property.

Make sure to pick props, followed by ., and finally backgroundColor.

lessons.title: Lesson #7
lessons.interactiveContent:
Create a custom class for the Notice component.

Make sure to pick className followed by = and then ", notice, ".

lessons.title: Lesson #8
lessons.interactiveContent:
In which file would you define styling for Button component exclusively?

Button.cssApp.cssHeader.cssindex.css

Make sure to pick Button.css.

lessons.title: Lesson #11
lessons.interactiveContent:
Implement a CSS file for Alert and change font size.

Make sure to pick import, followed by "./Alert.css", and finally ;.

lessons.title: Lesson #9
lessons.interactiveContent:
Create a CSS rule in App.css to add padding and apply it to div elements in the App component.

Make sure to pick ., followed by paddedDiv.

lessons.title: Lesson #10
lessons.interactiveContent:
In React, what keyword do we use when setting a CSS class in JSX?

classNamestyleNameclassclass-id

Make sure to pick className.

lessons.title: Lesson #8 - Copy
lessons.interactiveContent:
What is the correct way to import a stylesheet in a JSX file?

import "./App.css"import App from "./App.css"from "./App.css" import Apprequire "./App.css"

import "./App.css".

lessons.title: Lesson #9
lessons.interactiveContent:
Style the "Star Trek" quote in the React component.

Make sure to pick style followed by = and then {, {, }, }.

lessons.title: Lesson #10
lessons.interactiveContent:
Style the "Matrix" warning message in React using the predefined matrixStyle object.

Make sure to type matrixStyle.

lessons.title: Lesson #6
lessons.interactiveContent:
Which of the following is a correct JSX syntax to apply inline styles using a property from a component?

style={{ backgroundColor: props.bgColor }}style={ backgroundColor: "blue" }style={{ color: "red" }}style="background-color: blue;"

style={{ backgroundColor: props.bgColor }}.

lessons.title: Lesson #7
lessons.interactiveContent:
Use props to apply conditional border styles based on a number property called borderWidth.

Make sure to type borderWidth.
